name: logger
shortDescription: enter messages into the system log
longDescription: logger makes entries in the system log.

options.name: i
options.description: Log the logger command's PID.

options.name: id
options.description: Log the given <id>, or otherwise the PID.

options.name: stderr
options.description: Output message to standard error as well.

options.name: file
options.description: Log the contents of this file.

options.name: no-act
options.description: Do everything except the write the log.

options.name: priority
options.description: Mark given message with this priority.

options.name: tag
options.description: Mark every line with this tag.

options.name: socket
options.description: Write to this Unix socket.

options.name: socket-errors
options.description: Print connection errors when using Unix sockets(on|off|auto)

options.name: udp
options.description: Use UDP only.

options.name: tcp
options.description: Use TCP only.

options.name: server
options.description: Write to this remote syslog server.

options.name: port
options.description: Use this port for UDP or TCP connection.

options.name: octet-count
options.description: Use rfc6587 octet counting.

options.name: prio-prefix
options.description: Look for a prefix on every line read from stdin.

options.name: rfc3164
options.description: Use the obsolete BSD syslog protocol.

options.name: rfc5424
options.description: Use the syslog protocol (the default for remote);<snip> can be notime, or notq, and/or nohost.

options.name: size
options.description: Maximum size for a single message.

options.name: msgid
options.description: Set rfc5424 message id field.

options.name: skip-empty
options.description: Do not log empty lines when processing files.

options.name: sd-id
options.description: rfc5424 structured data ID.

options.name: sd-param
options.description: rfc5424 structured data name=value.

options.name: journald
options.description: Write journald entry.
